tutorial.title: Stylesheet and Basic Selectors
tutorial.descriptionContent: Discover how to add colors, font styles, and formatting to make beautiful webpages with CSS.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: We'll now move on to making great-looking websites with the help of a styling language called CSS, short for Cascading Style Sheets.

lessons.title: Style sheet
lessons.interactiveContent:
The best way to style a page is to create a new CSS file, which works with the HTML file to apply styles while keeping the code organized.

To connect both files, we add a link between the <head> tags.

Make sure to pick <link rel="stylesheet" href ="style.css" >.

lessons.title: Linking a style sheet
lessons.interactiveContent:
To include a style sheet in an HTML file, we use the link element. <link> is a self-closing empty element and it goes inside the head element.

Make sure to pick <link>.

lessons.title: Linking a style sheet
lessons.interactiveContent:
To know what kind of file to include, the opening link tag needs the rel attribute set using rel="stylesheet".

Make sure to pick rel, followed by =, and finally "stylesheet".

lessons.title: Linking a style sheet
lessons.interactiveContent:
To specify the style sheet's location, set the href attribute to "style.css".

Make sure to pick href, followed by =, and finally "style.css".

lessons.title: Linking a style sheet - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Assemble the full code to link a style sheet.

Make sure to pick <link, followed by rel="stylesheet", and finally href="style.css">.

lessons.title: Selecting
lessons.interactiveContent:
Inside the CSS file, we specify which element to style with a tag selector. Select the p⁠ tag.

Make sure to pick p.

lessons.title: Selecting
lessons.interactiveContent:
We then add an opening brace, {, followed by a closing brace, }⁠.

Make sure to pick {, followed by }.

lessons.title: Color
lessons.interactiveContent:
Now, any declaration we add will apply to all p elements on the webpage. Add the color: blue⁠;⁠ declaration.

Make sure to pick color followed by : and then blue, ;.

lessons.title: Rules
lessons.interactiveContent:
When we add p { followed by color: blue;, and then }, we create a CSS rule.

Make sure to pick p followed by { and then color: blue;, }.

lessons.title: Rules
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can add other declarations like background-color: pink as long as they're on another line.

Make sure to pick background-color: pink;.

executableContent.instructions:
We can use AI to create entire rules for us.

1. Ask AI to make the heading's background color pink.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Water Puns

When does it start to rain money? When there's change in the weather.

files.name: style.css

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can we style a website?

By adding CSS in a style sheetBy adding JavaScript in a script

By adding CSS in a style sheet.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we style elements on a webpage in an included style sheet?

Any changes to the style sheet become visible on the webpageThe elements become interactive

Any changes to the style sheet become visible on the webpage.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can we apply a style to an element?

By adding its name, braces, and the style changes in a style sheetBy using document.getElementById() in a style sheet

By adding its name, braces, and the style changes in a style sheet.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the href attribute do in this piece of code?

It allows the link element to find the style sheetIt tells the link element what kind of file to include

It allows the link element to find the style sheet.

lessons.title: Styling the body
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we want a style to apply to the entire page, we can use the body selector.

Make sure to pick body.

lessons.title: Background color
lessons.interactiveContent:
Setting the background color to blue; inside the body rule sets the background for the entire body.

Make sure to pick blue, followed by ;.

lessons.title: Setting the text color
lessons.interactiveContent:
Styles like color: white; when set inside the body rule will apply to all elements inside the body tag.

Code color: white;.

Make sure to type color: white;.

lessons.title: Adding more style
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can style as many elements as we want as long as we add a space between different rules.

Make sure to pick h1 followed by { and then font-family: Helvetica;, }.

lessons.title: Overlapping properties
lessons.interactiveContent: Using the body tag is one of the easiest ways to add overlapping rules on elements. We'll learn about the other ways soon.

lessons.title: Question 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why do we want to style the body element?

To apply style to all elements inside the body elementTo make the webpage interactive

To apply style to all elements inside the body element.

lessons.title: Question 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's wrong with this code?

The h1 selector is missing an opening curly braceThe h1 selector has a wrong CSS property inside

The h1 selector is missing an opening curly brace.

lessons.title: Question 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we change the background-color of the h1 element?

The background changes only for the h1 elementsThe background changes for all elements on the webpage

The background changes only for the h1 elements.

lessons.title: Question 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many rules can we add to our CSS file?

As many as we wantOnly one

As many as we want.

lessons.title: Example 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the background color of all elements on this webpage to the value azure and the color of the heading to gray.

Make sure to pick background-color: azure;, followed by color: gray;.

lessons.title: Example 4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set background-color to the value black.

Make sure to type background-color: black;.

executableContent.instructions: Use AI to figure out how to make the text in the paragraphs *italic*.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Great places in Italy

Bari

Rome

Venice

lessons.title: Question
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property does the italic value belong to?

font-stylefont-familyfont-weight

Make sure to pick font-style.
